byline.contributor: Katie Benner reported from San Francisco and Matt Apuzzo from Washington. Mike Isaac contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By KATIE BENNER and MATT APUZZO

abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation, in demanding Apple grant access to iPhone of San Bernardino gunman, is pursuing narrow focus in case; tactic involves one-time request for alternative operating system for single phone, and could provide advantage for FBI as two sides settle down to protracted legal battle; Apple is presenting its case as broadly as possible.
lead_paragraph: The government is portraying its request that Apple open an iPhone used by a terrorist as a one-time demand. Apple sees a much broader issue.

headline.main: Narrow Focus May Aid F.B.I. in Apple Case
headline.print_headline: Narrow Focus May Aid F.B.I. in Apple Case

snippet: The government is portraying its request that Apple open an iPhone used by a terrorist as a one-time demand. Apple sees a much broader issue.
